+
'''Bluecurve''' is a [[desktop theme]] for [[GNOME]] and [[KDE]] created by the [[Red Hat]] Artwork project. The main aim of Bluecurve was to create a consistent look throughout the [[Linux]] environment, and provide support for various Freedesktop.org desktop standards. It has been used in [[Red Hat Linux]] since version 8.0, and [[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora Core]].
The Bluecurve [[window (computing)|window]] borders and [[GTK+]] ([[widget (computing)|widget]]) theme have been replaced by those from [[Clearlooks]] (the first in Fedora Core 4, the second in FC5). However, the old Bluecurve themes ([[windowing]] and [[widget]]s) are still installed by default and can be selected in the theme manager. The Bluecurve [[icon (computing)|icon]] set remains installed in Fedora 7, But has been replaced as the default by Echo.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Artwork|title=Artwork|work=Fedora Wiki|publisher=[[Fedora Project]]|accessdate=2006-10-21|date=[[2006-10-06]]}}</ref>
The Bluecurve [[window (computing)|window]] borders and [[GTK+]] ([[widget (computing)|widget]]) theme have been replaced by those from [[Clearlooks]] (the first in Fedora Core 4, the second in FC5). However, the old Bluecurve themes ([[windowing]] and [[widget]]s) are still installed by default and can be selected in the theme manager. The Bluecurve [[icon (computing)|icon]] set remains installed in Fedora 7, But has been replaced as the default by Echo.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Artwork|title=Artwork|work=Fedora Wiki|publisher=[[Fedora Project]]|accessdate=2006-10-21|date=[[2006-10-06]]}}</ref>
